step1.sentence: Setting a realistic expectation from the start helped the team avoid frustration when the project took longer than hoped.

step2.story: Jenna wanted to run a marathon within three months, but her coach reminded her to have a realistic expectation given that she had just started training. They agreed on a half-marathon as a first milestone. With that adjusted goal in mind, Jenna felt motivated rather than overwhelmed.

step3.story: When David launched his small bakery, friends and family told him he would be profitable within the first month. His business mentor, however, encouraged him to keep a realistic expectation about the timeline. Most small food businesses take at least a year to break even, she explained. David listened and budgeted accordingly, keeping his day job part-time while the bakery grew. Six months later, when sales were steady but not yet covering all costs, he didn't panic. Having set a realistic expectation from the beginning gave him the patience to stay the course.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 현실적인 기대 — 실제 상황이나 조건에 부합하는 예상이나 바람을 뜻합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 일의 결과나 과정에 대해 지나치게 낙관하거나 비관하지 않고, 현실에 맞는 합리적인 기대를 세울 때 사용합니다. 'set/have a realistic expectation'의 형태로 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'realistic'은 라틴어 'realis(실제의)'에서 유래했고, 'expectation'은 라틴어 'expectare(기다리다, 바라보다)'에서 왔습니다. 두 단어가 결합해 '현실에 기반한 기대'라는 뜻의 연어가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 비현실적인 목표나 과도한 기대를 경계할 때 조언의 톤으로 많이 쓰입니다. 부정적이기보다는 성숙하고 실용적인 태도를 나타내는 표현입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You should have realistic expectations about how quickly you can learn a new language.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 새로운 언어를 얼마나 빨리 배울 수 있는지에 대해 현실적인 기대를 가져야 합니다.
